events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving their vehicle on the highway, requesting to start the claim process immediately.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident following review of the description mentioning a collision involving the customer's car.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the auto accident claim and establish contact with the claimant for further details.
The claim acknowledgement notification was sent to the customer confirming receipt and initiation of the claim process.
The agent requested the customer provide photos of vehicle damage, police report, and medical bills related to the auto accident.
Customer submitted all requested documentation including photos of the dented car, police collision report, and hospital bills.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence and police report to assess liability and extent of damages.
Investigators completed the review and confirmed that the claimant's vehicle was damaged due to a rear-end collision caused by another driver.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the cost of car repairs and medical expenses as per the investigation findings.
The customer responded positively, accepting the settlement offer and expressing gratitude for the prompt handling of their claim.
The claim was officially approved based on the customerâ€™s acceptance of the settlement proposal and completed investigation report.
The insurance payment was processed and issued to the customer covering all approved damages and related medical costs.
After payment issuance, the auto accident claim was closed with no further outstanding issues or disputes reported.
The fully processed auto accident claim was archived in the system for future reference and compliance purposes.
